question_text: Select two reasons why capacitive trackpads generally outperform resistive input surfaces in laptops.
answer_options: Capacitive pads detect input without pressure
Capacitive pads support multitouch gestures more easily
Resistive pads are immune to water damage
correct_answer: Capacitive pads detect input without pressure
Capacitive pads support multitouch gestures more easily
explanation: Capacitive trackpads can sense finger proximity and movement without needing pressure, and they handle multitouch more naturally than resistive designs.
